pages.text: Using the $(l:alchemy/phil_stone)Philosopher's Stone$(), it is possible to mass produce the basic metals: Copper, Tin, Iron, and Gold. All four of those metals break down into $(l:alchemy/early_alchemy#quicksilver)Quicksilver$() and one of the 4 strong acids when exposed to the $(l:alchemy/phil_stone)Philosopher's Stone$() as a catalyst.

Combining $(l:alchemy/early_alchemy#quicksilver)Quicksilver$() and one of the 4 strong acids using some Adamant as a catalyst will produce one of the 4 base metals, which can be cooled to solid and pulled out as nuggets, or extracted as molten metal with a $(l:alchemy/laboratory_glassware#fluid_injector)Fluid Injector$() and run through a $(l:heat/fluid_cooling_chamber)Fluid Cooling Chamber$() to produce ingots. Provided Quicksilver and the $(l:alchemy/strong_acids)4 strong acids$() have been automated at this point, this allows easily producing massive amounts of the 4 base metals.
